alert.note: Alert for Coeur d'Alene Area (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 24 at 4:43AM MDT until October 26 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FIRST MODERATE SNOW EVENT FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST ARRIVES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... .Significant mountain snow accumulation above 3000 feet and measurable snow for lower elevations below 2500 feet. A robust and cold weather system will deliver mountain snow, lowland rain-snow, and colder overnight temperatures lingering through the remainder of the week. Mountain passes will be impacted by the heavy snowfall and lowland areas may see impacts to trees and sensitive vegetation from wet snow accumulation. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between a half an inch and 3 inches. A 30 to 50 percent chance of over 3 inches of snow for the Waterville Plateau. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho including the Coeur d`Alene metro area. Portions of Central, North Central, and Northeast Washington including the Okanogan Valley, Waterville Plateau, Wenatchee Valley, Colville area, West Plains, and Spokane. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...10 to 15 percent chance of over 3 inches of snow for Spokane to Coeur d`Alene metro areas as well as Highway 97 from Tonasket to Chelan.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
